I chose this rating. Because it wasn't what i thought it was going to be, It was the total wrong movie, I disliked the movie to old of a movie for me. Other wise arrived in a timely manner and in good shape.
This would be a great addition to any collection.  I might be prejudiced because my Father-In-Law is John Doucette. Arrived promptly at a great price.

This DVD was not what I thought it was!  I was looking for the weekly tv show called "COPS" .  I was very disappointed of the content.  The write up was misleading!  I should have read the caption more closely. :(

Herbert L. Maris (1880-1960) was a Philly corporate lawyer who lent his name and case files to the TV series LOCK UP. Macdonald Carey portrayed Maris on this half-hour show, with John Doucette playing his detective pal, Lt. Weston. LOCK UP had a 78 episode, two season run from 9/26/59 to 6/17/61. It's interesting to see a mix of up and coming actors and former stars still keeping busy. For example, the very last broadcast, "The Case of Nan Havens," has Mary Tyler Moore in the title role but she's third billed on the "also" list. Jackie Coogan, who found childhood fame in Charlie Chaplin's THE KID (1921), is just another name in the beach-based chapter entitled "Society Doctor." (Coogan's career would soon revive as THE ADDAMS FAMILY's Uncle Fester.) Here, MISTER ED's Connie Hines and Joe Flynn, soon-to-be Capt. Binghamton of MCHALE'S NAVY, are the newcomers ("The Drop") and ex-vaudeville top comic Joey Faye picks up a paycheck ("His Father's Footsteps") in a minor role. Thanks to fine scripts and acting, these shows are all above average in quality. Definitely recommended. . Contents of COPS VOL. 2 - "Lock Up" (Includes episode numbers, original airdates and guest stars.) THE DROP (#14 - 12/26/59) - Corey Allen/Donna Jo Boyce/Joe Flynn/H.E. West THE MANLY ART OF MURDER (#15 - 1/2/60) - Tom Brown/Helen Walker/James Philbrook/William A. Forester/Joan Granville HIS FATHER'S FOOTSTEPS (#17 - 1/16/60) - Robert F. Simon/Paul Carr/Millie Barrett/Joan Granville/Joey Faye VOICE OF DOOM (#38 - 6/11/60) - Robert Roark/Claudia Barrett/Bella Brick/Buddy Douglas/Joian Granville/Steve Barclay BEAU AND ARROW CASE (#44 - 10/22/60) - James Best/Jack Ging/Connie Hines/George F. Stone/George Eldredge
